metadata.Title: CVE-2017-3636 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server component of Oracle MySQL (subcomponent:Client programs). Supported versions that are affected are 5.5.56 andearlier and 5.6.36 and earlier. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows lowprivileged attacker with logon to the infrastructure where MySQL Serverexecutes to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of thisvulnerability can result in unauthorized update, insert or delete access tosome of MySQL Server accessible data as well as unauthorized read access toa subset of MySQL Server accessible data and unauthorized ability to causea partial denial of service (partial DOS) of MySQL Server. CVSS 3.0 BaseScore 5.3 (Confidentiality, Integrity and Availability impacts). CVSSVector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:L).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-3636` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmariadbclient18 - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libmariadbd18 - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-client - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-client-10.1 - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-client-core-10.1 - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-common - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-plugin-connect - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-plugin-cracklib-password-check - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-plugin-gssapi-client - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-plugin-gssapi-server - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-plugin-mroonga - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-plugin-oqgraph - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-plugin-spider - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-plugin-tokudb - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-server - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-server-10.1 - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mariadb-server-core-10.1 - 1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: mariadb-10.1 package in esm-apps/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:10.1.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
